column2: SOUTH CAROLINA DMV PERMIT TEST
column4: South Carolina
column6: SC

column2: Question Text
column4: Answer1 Text
column6: Answer2 Text

column2: 1. When drivers come to this sign, they must:
column4: brake sharply and come to a complete stop.
column6: be ready to stop at the stop sign.
column8: warn other drivers that a stop sign is ahead.

column2: 2. Drivers should always signal when:
column4: pulling out of a parking space.
column6: changing lanes.

column2: 3. Your license will be suspended when you accumulate ______ under the point system law.
column4: 12 points
column6: 5 points

column2: 4. When it starts to snow while you are driving, you should:
column4: increase your following distance
column6: keep your windshield and mirrors clear.

column2: 5. The sign in the picture:
column4: is a Construction and Maintenance Traffic Control sign.
column6: is displayed on the rear of slow moving vehicles.
column8: is found at most intersections and indicates that drivers must yield to other vehicles.

column2: 6. If two vehicles reach the intersection at the same time:
column4: The first vehicle to reach the intersection has the right-of-way.
column6: The vehicle on the right yields to the vehicle on the left.
column8: The vehicle on the left yields to the vehicle on the right.

column2: 7. When you see a flashing yellow light at an intersection you should:
column4: Yield to all traffic before crossing the intersection.
column6: Stop, then enter the intersection when it is safe to do so.
column8: slow down and proceed carefully through the intersection.

column2: 8. Roads are most slippery:
column4: when it stops raining.
column6: when it first starts to rain.

column2: 9. This road sign means:
column4: Two-way traffic ahead
column6: Four-lane traffic ahead

column2: 10. Are bicyclists required to obey traffic laws and signs?
column4: Yes, but only if they are riding in a bicycle lane.
column6: No, bicyclists are considered pedestrians when it comes to the rules of the road.

column2: 11. ___________ normally are white rectangles with black letters or symbols.
column4: Warning signs
column6: Regulation signs (regulatory signs)

column2: 12. Drivers are required to stop:
column4: at an intersection where a police officer orders them to stop.
column6: where there is a red light.

column2: 13. The maximum unposted speed limit in an urban district or residential area is 30 MPH.
column4: False
column6: True

column2: 14. Talking or texting on a cell phone while driving will not significantly increase your chances of being involved in a crash.
column4: True
column6: False

column2: 15. When driving on a two-lane road, drivers must stop when approaching a stopped school bus unloading children.
column4: False
column6: True

column2: 16. What is the meaning of blue traffic signs?
column4: Blue indicates road user services.
column6: A blue background indicates a regulatory sign.

column2: 17. This sign indicates:
column4: Divided highway ends
column6: Merging traffic

column2: 18. You have stopped for a train at a railroad crossing. After the train passes, you must:
column4: look to see if another train is coming, then cross the tracks if it is safe to do so.
column6: watch for vehicles that must stop at railroad crossings (school buses, vehicles carrying hazardous materials, etc.).

column2: 19. What should you do if your vision through the windshield becomes blocked?
column4: Open the side window so you can see.
column6: Turn on your emergency lights.

column2: 20. This sign means:
column4: Roundabout ahead.
column6: 270 degree turn ahead.

column2: 21. Visibility distance is reduced by fog and heavy precipitation. When visibility is low, drivers should use:
column4: High beam headlights.
column6: Parking lights.

column2: 22. You are stopped at a stop sign and you are going to go straight through the intersection. A car on the cross road has stopped at a stop sign on your right and is going to go straight. Who has the right-of-way?
column4: Whoever enters the intersection first.
column6: The car on your right.

column2: 23. A person walking with a white cane or guide dog is likely to be:
column4: a blind person.
column6: a deaf person.

column2: 24. When you are planning to make a three point turn, and oncoming traffic is approaching, you should:
column4: Flash your headlights and begin the maneuver.
column6: start the turn, then stop and yield to oncoming vehicles when they are within 50 feet of your vehicle.
column8: yield to oncoming traffic from both directions before turning.

column2: 25. The sign in the picture:
column4: is used to advise motorists of the appropriate ramp speed at the highway exit point.
column6: indicates the minimum ramp speed at the highway exit point.
column8: shows the highest speed drivers can travel at the exit of the intersection.

column2: 26. What is the first thing you should do if your wheels move off the pavement?
column4: Ease your foot off the gas pedal and brake gently.
column6: Pull over to the right and sound your horn to warn the other drivers.

column2: 27. You want to turn left at an intersection ahead. A car reaches the intersection from the opposite direction and moves straight ahead. You:
column4: may not enter the intersection to prepare for your left turn if the light is green.
column6: can turn left. You have the right of way.
column8: must wait for the car to go through before you turn.

column2: 28. When drivers see this road sign:
column4: they must come to a complete stop and call the police.
column6: they must not drive past this sign.

column2: 29. What does a flashing red light mean?
column4: Drivers may move forward with caution.
column6: The same thing as a stop sign.

column2: 30. Green and white signs:
column4: warn drivers of unexpected road conditions.
column6: are mainly used at intersections and driveways.
column8: give information about directions and distances.
